job_details.Functieomschrijving:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

   - Experience (non-internship) in professional software development
   - Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems
   - Experience programming with at least one software programming language

   DESCRIPTION

   The Amazon Web Services (AWS) IDE team provides developers with different tools and services that make it easy to develop modern cloud applications. We provide the IDE Toolkits for Eclipse, IntelliJ, Visual Studio, and Visual Studio Code. With AWS Cloud9, we also provide our customers with a Web-based IDE. Our goal is enable professional developers to create applications targeting the Cloud, Server-less or containers. We help them author, debug, test, and ultimately deploy code on AWS.

   We are looking for a software development engineer who is passionate about building services and tools for developers. You will be part of a team building a new AWS service to enhance the developer experience in Cloud. The team works in close collaboration with other AWS services such as AWS Cloud9, AWS Fargate, and AWS ECS. If you are exited about the thought of working in cloud computing and building future AWS services, then we'd love to talk to you.

   Utility Computing (UC)
   AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations - from foundational services such as Amazon's Simple Storage Service (S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS's services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you'll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS. Within AWS UC, Amazon Dedicated Cloud (ADC) roles engage with AWS customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services.

   Key job responsibilities
   - Learn and use modern and advanced technologies
   - Collaborate with internal engineering teams, leading technology companies around the world and the open source community
   - Develop cloud-based solutions that will delight software developers and system administrators globally
   - Create innovative products and see them launched in high volume production environments
   - Participate in on-call rotation

   A day in the life
   Work/Life Harmony: Our team gives high value to work-life harmony. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.

   Mentorship & Career Growth: We're committed to the growth and development of every member of the team, and that includes our development managers. As a senior software development engineer you will play a vital part in growing your peers. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction and deliver site-wide initiatives that will improve the life of all of our teams. AWS is a growth environment - we are hiring and scaling rapidly to meet the needs of our customers. You'll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will have get to hire & develop other leaders along the way.

   On-Call Responsibility: This position involves On-call responsibility. We work as a team to root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.

   About the team
   You would work on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Next Gen DevX (NGDE) team where we are going to use generative AI and foundation models to reimagine the experience of all builders on AWS. From the IDE to web based tools and services AI will help engineers to work on large and small applications. In this team we have to explore new technologies and find creative solutions. Curiosity and an explorative mindset can find a place to impact the life of engineers around the world.

   About AWS
   Diverse Experiences
   AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   Why AWS?
   Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   Inclusive Team Culture
   Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   Mentorship & Career Growth
   We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   Work/Life Balance
   We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.

   We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

   Amsterdam, NLD

   PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

   - Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
   - Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
job_details.full_text:
Software Dev Engineer, AWS IDEs

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

   - Experience (non-internship) in professional software development
   - Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems
   - Experience programming with at least one software programming language

   DESCRIPTION

   The Amazon Web Services (AWS) IDE team provides developers with different tools and services that make it easy to develop modern cloud applications. We provide the IDE Toolkits for Eclipse, IntelliJ, Visual Studio, and Visual Studio Code. With AWS Cloud9, we also provide our customers with a Web-based IDE. Our goal is enable professional developers to create applications targeting the Cloud, Server-less or containers. We help them author, debug, test, and ultimately deploy code on AWS.

   We are looking for a software development engineer who is passionate about building services and tools for developers. You will be part of a team building a new AWS service to enhance the developer experience in Cloud. The team works in close collaboration with other AWS services such as AWS Cloud9, AWS Fargate, and AWS ECS. If you are exited about the thought of working in cloud computing and building future AWS services, then we'd love to talk to you.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description strongly emphasizes building new AWS services that reimagine the developer experience using generative AI and foundation models. It highlights the use of AI to help engineers work on applications, explore new technologies, and find creative solutions. While it mentions traditional software development and cloud services, the core focus on leveraging GenAI for developer tools and the mention of 'generative AI and foundation models' directly align with the definition and core responsibilities of a GenAI Engineer.

job_tasks.justification: The job description repeatedly mentions 'software development', 'software development engineer', 'building services and tools for developers', 'develop cloud-based solutions', and 'create innovative products'. The basic qualifications also include 'professional software development' and 'programming with at least one software programming language'. The preferred qualifications mention 'full software development life cycle'.
The role involves designing and architecting systems, including understanding 'design patterns, reliability and scaling' of new and existing systems, which are core software engineering principles.
job_tasks.phrase: designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems

job_tasks.justification: The description states 'programming with at least one software programming language', which is a fundamental aspect of software development.
job_tasks.phrase: programming with at least one software programming language

job_tasks.justification: The team's goal is to 'enable professional developers to create applications targeting the Cloud, Server-less or containers' and to help them 'author, debug, test, and ultimately deploy code on AWS', which are all software development activities.
job_tasks.phrase: enable professional developers to create applications targeting the Cloud, Server-less or containers

job_tasks.justification: The role involves developing 'cloud-based solutions that will delight software developers and system administrators globally' and creating 'innovative products'.
job_tasks.phrase: Develop cloud-based solutions that will delight software developers and system administrators globally

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations', which are all standard software development practices.
job_tasks.phrase: full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

job_tasks.justification: The 'About the team' section explicitly states the team will 'use generative AI and foundation models to reimagine the experience of all builders on AWS' and that 'AI will help engineers to work on large and small applications'. This directly points to the use and development of generative AI models.
job_tasks.phrase: use generative AI and foundation models to reimagine the experience of all builders on AWS

job_tasks.justification: The team's mission involves exploring 'new technologies and find creative solutions' and having 'Curiosity and an explorative mindset can find a place to impact the life of engineers around the world', in the context of using AI for developer experience.
job_tasks.phrase: explore new technologies and find creative solutions

job_tasks.justification: The job description mentions 'Participate in on-call rotation' and 'ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant'. This indicates responsibility for the operational health and maintenance of production systems.
The phrase 'root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant' is directly related to maintaining and operating production systems, a key aspect of MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant

job_tasks.justification: The role is within AWS IDE team, which 'provides developers with different tools and services that make it easy to develop modern cloud applications'. The goal is to 'enable professional developers to create applications targeting the Cloud, Server-less or containers'. This shows an understanding of the target user and their needs.
job_tasks.phrase: make it easy to develop modern cloud applications

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions working with 'other AWS services such as AWS Cloud9, AWS Fargate, and AWS ECS', indicating an understanding of the broader AWS ecosystem and how services integrate.
job_tasks.phrase: collaboration with other AWS services such as AWS Cloud9, AWS Fargate, and AWS ECS

job_tasks.justification: The role involves developing solutions that 'will delight software developers and system administrators globally', showing a focus on user satisfaction and global reach.
job_tasks.phrase: delight software developers and system administrators globally

job_tasks.justification: The team's mission is to 'reimagine the experience of all builders on AWS' using AI, which is a strategic business objective for enhancing developer productivity and adoption.
job_tasks.phrase: reimagine the experience of all builders on AWS

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with internal engineering teams, leading technology companies around the world and the open source community
You will play a vital part in growing your peers.
Learn and use modern and advanced technologies
root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant
take full responsibility for the quality and success of one's work
